titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Young Clark, Judgment
CWG6066

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky Hickman Circuit Court Sct.
May Term 1860
Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Breach Peace
Young Clark Defendant

The parties appeared by their attorneys and the defendant moved the Court to continue this prosecution and said motion being fully heard and understood is by the Court overruled and thereupon came a Jury to wit W B Kendall. L M Lee J M Moore James Black P R Vaughan John S Berry. J Q A Davis. James C Burgess, P M Vaughan J W Nichols. Robert Johnson. & HenryTarpley who being elected tried and sworn well and truly to try the issue joined and having fully heared the evidence and arguments of counsel returned into open Court the following verdict (viz) We of the Jury find said Clark guilty as charged in the within indictment and by reason thereof assess his fine to the Commonwealth at the sum of One hundred & six dollars May 15th 1860.

It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the said defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of one hundred & six dollars and that he pay the costs of this prosecution and may be taken & C.
Attest Thomas G Poore C. H. C. C

Hickman Cir Ct
Commonwealth Ky.
vs } Copy Judgt
Young Clark
